title: The 'abrupt reversal of fortune' that changed everything for Cooper Flagg and the Mavs

content: Steelers QB Aaron Rodgers said Tuesday on "The Pat McAfee Show" he's "pretty sure" the 2025 season will be his final NFL season.

title: LeBron: Flagg being drafted by Mavericks amazing
content: LeBron James has high praise for Cooper Flagg and thinks being drafted by the Mavericks is a perfect fit.

title: Sources: Celtics trading Holiday to Trail Blazers
content: The Celtics are trading Jrue Holiday to the Trail Blazers for Anfernee Simons and two second-round draft picks, sources told ESPN on Monday night.

title: QB Lyons, No. 49 recruit, picks BYU over Ducks
content: BYU secured its highest-ranked quarterback pledge since 2002 when four-star recruit Ryder Lyons, No. 49 in the 2026 ESPN 300, picked BYU over Oregon.

title: Sources: Knicks interviewing Wolves coach Nori
content: Timberwolves assistant coach Micah Nori is the third to formally interview with the Knicks for their head coaching job, sources told ESPN's Shams Charania on Tuesday.

title: Sources: Rangers to send 12th pick to Penguins
content: The Rangers are sending 12th pick in Friday's NHL draft to the Penguins to complete the conditions from their acquisition of forward J.T. Miller last season, sources told ESPN

title: Comedian Gillis chosen to host ESPYS on July 16
content: Comedian Shane Gillis will celebrate the achievements, athletes and moments in sports from the past year as host of the ESPYS in July, it was announced.

content: The U.S. has been without several stars at this summer's Gold Cup, so which fringe players have stepped up to fight for a place at next year's World Cup?

title: Concacaf clears Canada coach Marsch after probe
content: Concacaf has cleared Canada coach Jesse Marsch of any wrongdoing following an investigation into an alleged use of abusive language toward Gold Cup officials.

title: Miami's unbeaten run sets up CWC clash with PSG
content: Palmeiras came from behind to draw 2-2 with host Inter Miami at Hard Rock Stadium on Monday night, with both clubs advancing to the Club World Cup round of 16 and setting up a matchup between Miami and Paris Saint-Germain.

title: Wrexham legend Paul Mullin leaves club on loan
content: Paul Mullin, the poster boy of a Wrexham team soaring through England's football leagues following their takeover by Hollywood celebrities, has left the club to join League One side Wigan on a season-long loan deal.

title: Man arrested for death threats to Spain's Morata
content: A 19-year-old man has been arrested for making online death threats against √Ålvaro Morata and his family following the Spain captain's penalty miss against Portugal in the UEFA Nations League final.

title: Source: Forest in talks for Juve's Weah, Mbangula
content: Nottingham Forest are looking to Italy and have set their sights on Juventus players Timothy Weah and Samuel Mbangula to strengthen their squad this summer.

title: Chelsea's Jackson handed two-match ban after red
content: Chelsea's Nicolas Jackson has been handed a two-match ban following his red card against Flamengo at the Club World Cup, FIFA have confirmed.

title: Alex Telles: Botafogo not in U.S. just to 'see Mickey'
content: Botafogo have defied their critics by making it to the Club World Cup last 16, with Alex Telles saying the Brazilian club proved wrong those who said they came to the U.S. just to "see Mickey."

title: Spain's Putellas: 'I'm a better Alexia now'
content: Spain's Alexia Putellas say she is a "better Alexia now" as she looks to prove a point at this summer's European Championship after missing the last one through injury.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Casemiro to join Ronaldo at Al Nassr?
content: Manchester United midfielder Casemiro could be reunited with Cristiano Ronaldo at Al Nassr. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Whitcomb, Amihere lead top pickups this week
content: Sami Whitcomb and Laeticia Amihere are positioned to produce for their teams and fantasy managers ahead of a busy week in the WNBA.

title: Boxing divisional rankings: Norman closing in on top spot at welterweight

title: Jake Paul vs. Julio Cesar Chavez Jr.: How to find betting value for the fight
content: Taking Jake Paul to win doesn't offer much value, but there are other bets to consider for Saturday's bout.

title: Waiver wire: Find someone like Jo Adell?
content: Todd Zola outlines the players you should be claiming off the waiver wire. Rumor has it you should be looking at the Angels outfield.

title: India cannot develop with single ideology or leader; Emergency was bid to end multi-party democracy: Amit Shah¬†
content: It is not only courts and Parliament that are responsible for protecting the spirit of the Constitution, the Home Minister said, emphasising that the responsibility lies with the people too

title: PM Modi invites Mauritian counterpart Ramgoolam to visit India
content: In a telephonic conversation, PM Modi and Mauritius PM Ramgoolam discussed the ongoing cooperation across a broad range of areas, including development, defence, and people-to-people relations

title: Devanahalli farmers reject govt‚Äôs proposal on land acquisition and set to embark on a broad-based struggle from today
content: While Large and Medium Industries Minister M.B. Patil offered to drop acquisition in three villages, the farmers groups insisted that acquisition of fertile lands in all the villages in the project area by KIADB should be dropped

title: Two lakh people affected by Ghatal floods, thousands evacuated: West Bengal Minister
content: A war of words has ensued between the Trinamool Congress and Bharatiya Janata Party over the Ghatal flood management project

title: Bihar cabinet approves ‚Çπ4,026 crore marriage hall scheme in all gram panchayats
content: Mukhya Mantri Kanya Vivah Mandap Yojana to be implemented over five years; host of welfare and development measures also cleared

title: Centre to challenge Jammu and Kashmir High Court order on repatriation of deported woman
content: The 63-year-old housewife was deported to Pakistan following the crackdown against Pakistani nationals post-Pahalgam terror attack

title: Uttarakhand BJP issues notice to ex-MLA amid allegations of marrying actor without divorcing wife
content: Rathore‚Äôs alleged ‚Äòsecond marriage‚Äô came at a time when the State adopted Uniform Civil Code earlier this year which has strict rules for matrimonial relationships

title: As Rahul Gandhi repeats Maharashtra voter roll allegations, ECI says he did not respond to invite for talks
content: Congress leader shares report that CM‚Äôs seat saw 8% surge in voters before Assembly poll; ECI wrote to him on June 12, suggesting a meeting; CM says many Opposition-won seats also saw voter surge

title: Ministry of External Affairs welcomes reports of a ceasefire between Iran and Israel
content: ‚ÄòWe wish to reiterate that there is no alternative to dialogue and diplomacy in order to address and resolve the multiple conflicts in the region,‚Äô the MEA said

title: Bike taxi riders decry double standards in Karnataka‚Äôs transport policy
content: The riders questioned why two-wheeler delivery agents are allowed to operate freely with white number plates while bike taxi riders using the same vehicles are penalised for passenger transport.

title: CGHS Directorate pulled up by Public Accounts Committee for not revising drug procurement policy
content: Members raised concerns over the supply of outdated drugs to beneficiaries; delays in the settlement of claims; and the absence of coverage for the latest medical procedures under the scheme

title: A.P. Cabinet approves land allotment for Cognizant Tech Park in Vizag
content: 22 acres of land at Madhurawada to be leased to the company at a nominal rate of ‚Çπ0.99 per acre,  the IT major is expected to invest ‚Çπ1,582 crore and create over 8,000 direct jobs

title: Supreme Court stays deportation of woman from Assam, directs government to not take any coercive steps
content: Jaynab Bibi has claimed that generations of her family have lived in Assam and have documents to prove their Indian nationality

title: Businessline conclave to focus on MSMEs‚Äô role in ‚ÄòMake in India‚Äô mission
content: The fourth edition, to be held in two cities, Bengaluru (June 25) and Coimbatore (June 27), will discuss MSME‚Äôs  contribution to the Indian growth story

title: Five die after suspected gas leak in well at Madhya Pradesh village
content: Victims had entered 70 feet deep well in Guna district to rescue a cow; toxic exposure suspected, probe under way

title: Party high command asks Siddaramaiah to rein in erring legislators
content: Chief Minister meets President Draupadi Murmu to discuss the Bills awaiting the President‚Äôs assent and requests her to clear them

title: Verification pending on MPs‚Äô signatures for Judge Shekhar Yadav‚Äôs removal notice
content: Rajya Sabha Secretariat confirms 44 signatures; Kapil Sibal, nine others yet to verify amid procedural delays

title: Railways considers a marginal hike in fares from July 1
content: Mail, Express fares likely to be hiked by one paisa per km; A/C coach fares to be raised two paise per km; suburban and monthly season ticket rates will remain unchanged; there will be no increase for ordinary second-class tickets up to 500 km¬†

title: Safran to expand operations with MRO facility for Rafale
content: The initiative is expected to create around 150 jobs by 2026 with potential to add another 750 positions in subsequent phases

title: Naidu seeks to allay Telangana‚Äôs concerns over Polavaram-Banakacharla Project
content: CM tells Ministers and alliance leaders to explain to the public that the project utilises only surplus floodwaters left after Telangana‚Äôs use and does not pose any threat to the neighbouring State‚Äôs interests

title: CM accuses the media of villainising organised labour while lionising exploitative corporate employers
content: CM says the Sangh Parivar fear the idea of a pro-worker, progressive, secular and democratic Kerala and worked overtime with the Central government‚Äôs help to retard the State‚Äôs development and undermine its robust social security net. He accused the Sangh Parivar of stoking communalism to divert public attention from working-class woes and pressing livelihood issues.

title: Devise ways to increase revenue of gram panchayats for a more effective Panchayati Raj system: Amit Shah
content: In a meeting attended by the CMs of four BJP-ruled States, the Union Home Minister said all States should ensure the eradication of child malnutrition, bring the school dropout ratio down to zero, and strengthen the cooperative sector

title: Endosulfan stored for 25 years in Kasaragod shifted to new barrels for neutralisation
content: Central Pollution Control Board completes repacking of the toxic chemical, stored in four barrels at Periye estate, into eight high density polythene containers

title: EAGLE and police officers urge students to stay away from drugs
content: EAGLE is planning awareness drives across the State to prevent drug smuggling and consumption, says official

title: Contractor hacked to death in Shiggaon
content: The assailants waylaid the victim in front of a two-wheeler showroom and attacked him with lethal weapons

title: Housing Minister should quit, BJP says and demands CBI probe into allotment¬†‚Äòscam‚Äô
content: Zameer Ahmed Khan should resign for rampant corruption or the Chief Minister should immediately suspend him, says Rajkumar Telkur

title: Himachal Pradesh Bill shielding public servants from arrest without government sanction receives President‚Äôs assent¬†
content: In the statement of objects and reasons, Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu has said that the amendment was being brought ‚Äòto enable public servants to discharge their duties fearlessly‚Äô

title: APUWJ calls for fight against fake news
content: The keynote speakers at the seminar, presided over by APUWJ State President I.V. Subba Rao, raise awareness on artificial intelligence, social media, and the approach to deal with the false stories

title: Centre consents to transfer 1,245 acres of Salt Commission‚Äôs land to AP Maritime Board in Kakinada¬†
content: A team of revenue officials led by Collector has taken up an exercise to assess the value of the land sought to be transferred, which is located in Kakinada city and Karapa and Tallarevu mandals

title: IND vs ENG Test: Five hundreds, no win ‚Äì India's century party ends in a hangover
content: England defeated India in a thrilling match at Headingley, taking a 1-0 lead in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy. Despite India's five individual centuries, England's strong batting performance, led by Jamie Smith and Joe Root, secured a record chase. India's inexperienced side couldn't capitalize on key moments, while England maintained composure to clinch victory.

title: 'Killed not because they knew physics but ... ': Israel kills 14 Iran scientists
content: Israel has openly acknowledged its military campaign targeting Iran's nuclear program, which involved the assassination of at least 14 senior Iranian nuclear scientists. According to Israeli officials, these individuals were directly involved in the creation and production of nuclear weapons.

title: Middle East conflict: Why Pakistan is the big loser
content: In a world defined by chaos, the US reminded everyone who still runs the show. Operation Midnight Hammer, led by Trump and executed with B-2 Spirit bombers, dismantled Iran‚Äôs nuclear infrastructure and revived American military swagger. Trump emerged as the ultimate winner, along with Netanyahu and the neocons. Meanwhile, the Axis of Resistance crumbled, Palestine was sidelined, and Pakistan embarrassed itself by nominating Trump for a Nobel before condemning him. China and Russia watched helplessly. As The Newsroom once noted, America leads in defence spending‚Äîand now, in reminding the world that it still decides when and how the show ends.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Scoreline doesn't change that': Gambhir on Bumrah playing 'three Tests'
content: India's Test series under Shubman Gill started with a five-wicket defeat to England, raising concerns about managing Jasprit Bumrah's workload. Coach Gautam Gambhir confirmed Bumrah will play only three of the five Tests, regardless of the scoreline. England's historic win, chasing 371, highlighted India's batting collapses despite individual centuries.

title: New US Visa rule: Visa applicants to change this setting on FB, Instagram
content: The US embassy in India has announced that applicants for F, M, and J non-immigrant visas must now make their social media accounts public. This new guideline aims to help U.S. officials verify the identity and eligibility of visa applicants during the security screening process. The embassy stated this change is necessary to facilitate vetting and establish admissibility under U.S.

title: Operation Sindhu: 3,170 Indians evacuated from conflict-hit Israel, Iran
content: India successfully evacuated over 1,100 citizens from Iran and Israel. This evacuation was amidst rising tensions. Operation Sindhu brought back a total of 3,170 Indians. Evacuees from Israel were transported via Jordan and Egypt. Chartered flights from Amman and special flights from Mashhad facilitated the return. The conflict between Israel and Iran prompted this swift action by India.

title: Ostrava Golden Spike: Neeraj Chopra clinches top prize with 85.29m throw, only athlete to breach 85m-mark at event
content: Neeraj Chopra clinched the men's javelin title at the Ostrava Golden Spike meet in the Czech Republic with a throw of 85.29 metres. This victory follows his recent triumph at the Paris Diamond League. Douw Smit of South Africa secured second place, while Anderson Peters from Grenada finished third in the competition directed by Jan Zelezny.

title: 'Not leaping to join BJP': Tharoor on his Op Sindoor article
content: Shashi Tharoor clarified that his praise for PM Modi's diplomatic efforts during Operation Sindoor doesn't signal a shift to the BJP. He emphasised national unity and India's interests as his motivations, highlighting the importance of cross-party solidarity in foreign policy. Tharoor's article sparked speculation amid Congress's criticism of the government's foreign policy.

title: 'Jeff Bezos is on the run‚Ä¶', protestor claims as 'twist' expected in wedding
content: Jeff Bezos and Lauren S√°nchez's lavish Venetian wedding celebrations are reportedly facing potential disruptions due to protests and security concerns. The couple is considering last-minute venue changes, with contingency plans in place across multiple locations. Protesters are denouncing the event as emblematic of Venice's exploitation, while officials have lobbied to host the high-profile wedding.

title: 'We lose together, win together': Gambhir backs bowlers as Eng pull off record chase
content: England achieved a stunning five-wicket victory over India in the first Test at Headingley, chasing down a target of 371. Despite Rishabh Pant's twin centuries and India's mammoth score, batting collapses proved costly. Coach Gautam Gambhir emphasised the need to support the team and focus on collective improvement rather than blaming individuals, backing Shubman Gill's captaincy despite the loss.

title: 'We had our chances': Gill rues drop catches as England draw first blood
content: Shubman Gill lamented India's missed opportunities after England's thrilling five-wicket victory in the first Test, highlighting dropped catches and lower-order batting failures. Ben Duckett's brilliant 149 and a crucial partnership between Joe Root and Jamie Smith guided England to overhaul the 371-run target. Gill acknowledged the need to rectify batting collapses and capitalize on chances in the upcoming matches.

title: '1 minute mein 3 ball daal sakta hai kya?: Rishabh Pant trolls Mohammed Siraj - WATCH
content: During the India-England Test, Rishabh Pant's witty encouragement aimed to energize India's bowling attack before lunch. Despite Jasprit Bumrah's sharp performance and crucial dismissal of Duckett, other pacers struggled with consistency. England's openers, Duckett and Crawley, exploited loose deliveries, forming a strong partnership.

title: How Bill Gates reacted 'very differently' when their daughter announced her startup
content: Phoebe Gates, daughter of Bill Gates, has launched Phia, an e-commerce app co-founded with Sophia Kianni. The platform utilizes AI to compare prices across numerous websites, offering users a comprehensive view of both new and second-hand fashion items. Bill Gates initially expressed concern about potential financial requests and involvement but ultimately supported Phoebe's entrepreneurial endeavor.

title: A flight to nowhere! Qantas flight, airborne for 15 hours, returns to origin airport
content: A Qantas Airways flight from Perth to Paris was forced to return to its origin after 15 hours due to Iranian missile strikes causing widespread airspace closures in the Middle East. The diversion impacted other Qantas services, including the Perth-London route, which was rerouted to Singapore.

title: Nightmare! Yashasvi creates 'unwanted record'; furious Gambhir reacts
content: In the first Test against England, Yashasvi Jaiswal had a tough time with dropped catches. KL Rahul scored a composed century. Rishabh Pant blasted a quickfire ton. Their partnership helped India set a target of 371. Pant also made history as the first Indian wicketkeeper to score two centuries in a Test away from home.

title: 'Mera hi umpire, mera hi game': Rishabh Pant's stump mic banter with Jadeja goes viral - WATCH
content: Rishabh Pant's lively chatter behind the stumps entertained fans during the first Test, but his on-field dissent earned him an ICC reprimand and a demerit point for breaching the Code of Conduct. The incident occurred when Pant disagreed with the umpires' decision not to replace the ball.

title: Dwyane Wade‚Äôs daughter steals spotlight dancing in white lehanga
content: A delightful Instagram video of Kaavia James, daughter of Dwyane Wade and Gabrielle Union, has captured hearts globally. The six-year-old is seen joyfully dancing to the Bollywood hit ‚ÄúWhat Jhumka?‚Äù while dressed in a traditional white lehenga. The heartwarming clip, posted by her parents, celebrates cultural exploration and youthful exuberance.

title: Israel says 'refrained' from further strikes after Trump-Netaynahu call
content: Following a phone call with US President Donald Trump, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's office announced a halt to further strikes on Iran, after 12 days of conflict. This decision came after Israel accused Iran of violating the ceasefire brokered by Trump, even vowing a forceful response. Trump expressed displeasure with Israel's immediate actions after the ceasefire agreement.

title: 'She‚Äôs heartbroken': Blake Lively breaks down as Taylor Swift cuts ties
content: The friendship between Blake Lively and Taylor Swift has ended. Sources say Lively is heartbroken after Swift cut ties. Legal issues involving Justin Baldoni's case add complexity. Lively must submit texts with Swift. Rumors suggest Lively tried to leverage her Swift connection. Travis Kelce supports Swift during this difficult time. Swift's upcoming album may reflect themes of betrayal.

title: 4th-floor suicide bid foiled in seconds: Chennai woman dragged back from window ledge
content: Sub-Inspector Meera of the Mambalam Police Station was lauded for her quick thinking and bravery after rescuing a 27-year-old woman from a suicide attempt in T. Nagar. Dovina, distressed over a failed relationship, threatened to jump from her apartment window.

title: Tony Gonzalez ex Lauren Sanchez engaged ‚Äî set to wed Jeff Bezos in Venice ‚Äî NFL legend left behind
content: Lauren Sanchez, former girlfriend of Tony Gonzalez and mother to his son Nikko, is set to marry Jeff Bezos in a lavish Venetian wedding. The event, estimated at $50,000 per guest, will host 200 A-listers. Despite some online confusion, Gonzalez's wife, October, remains close to Sanchez and even attended her bachelorette party.

title: Who won the war - Iran, Israel or US? The battle of Middle East dominance
content: Amidst a week of intense exchanges between Iran and Israel, with the US acting as both aggressor and mediator, a fragile equilibrium has emerged. While missiles flew and bases were targeted, all parties are claiming victory, signaling a desire to de-escalate and avoid further conflict. Despite the heavy costs and ongoing tensions, a path towards diplomacy is cautiously being explored.

title: 'Shared husband‚Äôs live location': Telangana man murdered by bride‚Äôs lover
content: A 32-year-old land surveyor from Gadwal was murdered by hired killers, allegedly orchestrated by his wife's lover. The victim, G Tejeshwar, married T Sahasra against his family's wishes a month prior. Police have arrested four suspects, including the wife and three hitmen, while the main accused, the wife's lover, remains at large

title: Born to shine: Diljit Dosanjh now part of Canada's Toronto Metropolitan University curriculum
content: Diljit Dosanjh's global impact is set to be explored in a new course at Toronto Metropolitan University, focusing on his cultural and musical relevance. The course, launching in late 2026, will examine his influence on global pop culture and diasporic communities. This announcement arrives amidst controversy surrounding his upcoming movie due to casting a Pakistani actress, sparking boycott calls.

title: 'Boats are sailing, cars are floating': Congress slams BJP's Gujarat model
content: Congress leader Supriya Shrinate criticized BJP's Gujarat Smart City model as heavy rain caused severe flooding in Surat. Over 400 mm of rain in 36 hours submerged roads and homes, disrupting daily life. The IMD has issued warnings for continued rainfall in Gujarat and Rajasthan, with an orange alert for eastern Rajasthan.

title: Tensions flare at Headingley! Siraj loses his cool at England openers over time-wasting drama
content: The first session of the India versus England Test saw a tense moment. Zak Crawley delayed Mohammed Siraj's over, disrupting India's plan. England's openers, Ben Duckett and Zak Crawley, batted strongly. They forged an unbeaten 117-run partnership. Bumrah missed a catch. England reached lunch at 117/0, needing 254 more runs. The match hangs in the balance with all results possible.

title: Youth's body coated with cement & stuffed in trunk found dumped in Raipur
content: A chilling murder has rocked Raipur as authorities discovered a man's body encased in cement within a suitcase and steel trunk. Residents alerted police to a foul odor emanating from the abandoned trunk. Swift investigation led to the arrest of a lawyer, Ankit Upadhyay, and his wife at Delhi airport as they attempted to flee.

title: Diplomatic deja vu: Trump pulls off an India-Pakistan on Israel-Iran
content: US President Donald Trump unilaterally declared a ceasefire between Israel and Iran, a move that surprised even his own administration and the involved nations. Trump claimed both countries sought his intervention for peace. He outlined a detailed ceasefire plan on social media, complete with a timeline, despite ongoing missile exchanges.

title: Telangana horror: Woman killed by daughter and her boyfriend; struck with hammer
content: In Jeedimetla, a 39-year-old woman was allegedly murdered by her daughter and the daughter's boyfriend, Shiva, whom she met on Instagram. The victim had previously filed a complaint against Shiva after her daughter eloped with him. The police brought them back, but further action was pending court orders. The victim's sister alleges the pair killed her with a hammer.

title: James Harden sued ‚Äî nephew‚Äôs assault at Houston party sparks negligence claim ‚Äî Clippersstarnamed
content: James Harden is facing a civil lawsuit in Harris County, Texas, stemming from an alleged r*pe at his New Year‚Äôs Eve party. Marisa Watley accuses Harden's nephew of assault and claims Harden's security team was negligent in preventing the incident. The lawsuit seeks damages, alleging Harden is vicariously liable for his guards' actions.

title: 'Friendly plane wave': Israel defies Trump's ceasefire plan; launches missiles at Iran
content: Following a ceasefire agreement, tensions flared again between Israel and Iran, prompting US President Donald Trump to intervene. Trump assured that Israel would cease its attacks, claiming they would simply do a "Plane Wave" to Iran. Despite the ceasefire announcement, both sides accused each other of violations, with Israel citing Iranian missile fire.

title: 'No alternative to dialogue & diplomacy': India welcomes ceasefire between Israel & Iran
content: India has expressed its approval of the ceasefire between Israel and Iran, acknowledging it as a positive move amidst rising regional tensions. The Ministry of External Affairs lauded the diplomatic efforts of the United States and Qatar in facilitating the fragile truce. India reiterated that dialogue is essential for resolving regional disputes and offered support for further peacebuilding initiatives.

title: 'Worn out tyres to faded runway line': DGCA audit report finds aviation lapses
content: A DGCA audit of India's aviation sector has revealed safety lapses, including worn aircraft tires, recurring defects due to ineffective repairs, and faded runway markings. The surveillance also found issues with ground handling equipment, maintenance procedures, and vehicles lacking speed governors. The DGCA has directed concerned operators to take corrective actions within seven days to address these critical findings.

title: Jammu-Srinagar tunnel: All-weather route for troops, convoys on the cards
content: In Jammu and Kashmir, the Centre is reconsidering financial approvals for the Singhpora-Vailoo and Sudhmahadev-Dranga tunnel projects to enhance year-round connectivity. These projects aim to establish a safer alternative to the Jammu-Srinagar NH 44. Additionally, the Peer Ki Gali tunnel on the Mughal Road is part of a broader initiative to provide crucial all-weather routes.

title: Bigg Boss fame Sana Khan shares an emotional post after her mother passed away
content: Sana Khan, the former Bigg Boss contestant, is mourning the loss of her mother, Mrs. Saeeda. Sana shared the heartbreaking news on social media, requesting prayers for her mother, who passed away after struggling with her health. The actress, who left the entertainment industry in 2020, had always emphasized her mother's significant role in her life and success.

title: Truce violation: Trump says 'really unhappy with Israel, not happy with Iran either'
content: Donald Trump has criticized both Israel and Iran for allegedly violating the recent ceasefire agreement. He specifically disapproved of Israel's immediate response following the truce, referencing reported airstrikes after a missile launch from Iran. While acknowledging the violations, Trump remains uncertain if the ceasefire is entirely broken.

title: Brandon Aiyuk exposes 49ers‚Äô betrayal during injury: 'They wanted to trade me on Percs'
content: Brandon Aiyuk claims the San Francisco 49ers considered trading him. This happened while he recovered from a knee injury. Aiyuk expressed his frustration on YouTube. He signed a $120 million extension with the team. However, he feels disrespected. Aiyuk believes the 49ers are not being genuine. He wants to address the situation. The incident has created tension within the team.

title: WATCH | 'Ek taraf se Mohammad, ek taraf se Krishna': Gill's rally cry
content: Shubman Gill motivated Mohammed Siraj and Prasidh Krishna on Day 5 of the first Test. England chased 371 runs, reaching 117 at lunch without losing a wicket. Gill's remark about the bowlers was caught on the stump mic. Teams observed silence for Dilip Doshi's passing. England needed 254 more runs with all wickets in hand to win the match.

title: Udaipur shocker: French tourist sexually assaulted; FIR filed, accused flees
content: In Udaipur's Tiger Hill area, a French tourist reported a sexual assault after visiting a local caf√©. Following a visit to The Greek Farm caf√©, the victim allegedly left with a man named Siddharth, who is accused of taking her to his room and committing the assault.

title: SCO summit in China: Ajit Doval urges nations to 'shun double standards against terrorism'
content: NSA Ajit Doval addressed the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation, urging members to abandon double standards in combating terrorism and hold accountable those responsible for cross-border attacks. He highlighted India's concern over UN-proscribed terror groups and advocated for a joint information operation to counter terrorism, separatism, and extremism within the SCO framework.

title: Grenade Explodes At Security Forces Camp In Assam, 3 Cops Injured
content: A grenade exploded in a security forces camp in Assam's Golaghat district on Tuesday night, leaving three police personnel injured.

title: In A Surprise Announcement, Trump Asks China To 'Keep Buying Oil From Iran'
content: In a sudden twist in Washington's Iran policy, US President Donald Trump made an unexpected announcement shortly after declaring a ceasefire between Iran and Israel after nearly two weeks of air strikes and missile attacks.

title: Jagan Reddy's Bulletproof Car, Involved In Accident In Which Supporter Died, Seized
content: The Andhra Pradesh police on Tuesday seized YSRCP chief Y S Jagan Mohan Reddy's bulletproof vehicle, which was allegedly involved in an accident during his recent tour of Rentapalla village in Palnadu district.

title: Russia Welcomes Iran-Israel Ceasefire, Hopes It Will Last
content: Russia said on Tuesday that it would welcome a ceasefire between Iran and Israel, after both sides and US President Donald Trump announced a halt in hostilities.

title: Delhi Woman Allegedly Pushed Off From Rooftop, Dies; Accused Arrested
content: A 19-year-old woman, who was allegedly pushed off the rooftop of her house in northeast Delhi's Ashok Nagar area by a person known to her, has succumbed to her injuries during treatment, an official said on Tuesday.

title: 2.5 Million Refugees Face Uncertainty As Global Resettlement Access Shrinks
content: An estimated 2.5 million refugees worldwide will need to be resettled next year, the UN said Tuesday, at a time when the United States but also other nations are shrinking resettlement access.

title: UN Rights Chief Urges Sri Lanka To Ensure Accountability For Wartime Atrocities
content: The United Nations human rights chief urged Sri Lanka on Tuesday to ensure accountability for crimes committed during its protracted ethnic war.

title: UK Government Says Chinese Spying On The Rise, Pledges $818 Million To Intelligence
content: Chinese spying and attempts by Beijing to undermine Britain's democracy and economy have risen in recent years, the UK government said Tuesday in a report on the Asian giant.

title: Iran Says Not Seeking Nuclear Weapons But Will Assert 'Legitimate Rights'
content: Iran's President Masoud Pezeshkian said Tuesday that his country was not seeking nuclear weapons but would continue to defend its "legitimate rights" in the peaceful use of nuclear energy.

title: "We Overcame Dark Chapter Like Emergency As Our Nation...": Amit Shah
content: Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday slammed Congress for the imposition of Emergency in 1975 and said, "We overcame a dark chapter like the Emergency because our nation never bows down to dictatorship".

title: Sonam Raghuvanshi, Raj Kushwaha Admitted To Relationship: Cops On Honeymoon Murder
content: Sonam Rahuvanshi and her boyfriend Raj Kushwaha, who had allegedly conspired and killed her husband Raja Raghuvanshi, have admitted to their relationship, the Meghalaya police have said.

title: Trains Halted, Highway Closed After Massive Landslide In Assam's Dima Hasao
content: Train and road connectivity between the Assam towns of Haflong and Silchar has been severely disrupted following a landslide near the Jatinga-Lampur section.

title: Trump Says Doesn't Want 'Regime Change' In Iran, Cites Risk of Chaos
content: US President Donald Trump said Tuesday he didn't want to see "regime change" in Iran amid its conflict with Israel, adding that it would cause "chaos."

title: "No Local Involvement": Omar Abdullah On Arrest Of 2 Men Over Pahalgam Attack
content: Days after the National Investigation Agency or NIA arrested two locals for allegedly harbouring three Pakistani terrorists behind the massacre of 26 people in Pahalgam, J&K Chief Minister Omar Abdullah insisted there is no local involvement.

title: Nuclear Power Plant To Be Set Up In Bihar, Says Union Minister
content: Union Power Minister Manohar Lal on Tuesday said that a nuclear power plant and a 1,000 MW battery storage capacity unit would be set up in Bihar.

title: "Didn't Abandon Her": Grandson Of Woman Found Near Mumbai Garbage Dump
content: An elderly woman was found lying over piles of garbage in Mumbai on Saturday. The woman had allegedly informed police that her grandson had left her there. Her grandson, however, has claimed that she left the house on her own and that he did not aban

title: Bodies Of 259 Air India Crash Victims Have Been Identified: Officials
content: All the bodies from the Air India Boeing Dreamliner crash in Ahmedabad have been recovered and several of the are still undergoing DNA matching, sources have said.

title: Centre To Compensate Mango Farmers In Karnataka, Minister Pralhad Joshi Praises Move
content: The Central government has announced the compensation under the 'Price Deficiency Payment Scheme' (PDPS) for mango farmers from Karnataka, days after Union Minister Pralhad Joshi raised the issue with Agriculture Minister Shivraj Chouhan.

title: Navy Veteran, Capt MS Kohli, Who Led India's 1st Successful Everest Expedition, Dies At 93
content: Navy veteran and legendary mountaineer Capt M S Kohli(retd), who had the singular honour of leading India's first successful expedition to Mt. Everest in 1965, has died. He was 93.

title: What Ancient Ice Sheets Can Tell Us About Future Sea Level Rise
content: When visiting Godrevy beach on the north Cornish coast, most people look out to sea at the lighthouse, surfers and seals rather than the cliffs behind.

title: Our early 2025-26 NBA Power Rankings: Stacking all 30 teams
content: the Oklahoma City Thunder are crowned the new champions of the league . the 2024-25 season has officially come to a close . our writers reflect on what to expect this offseason and put down the groundwork for what should be another competitive, unpredictable, 2025-26 season .

title: MMA World Power Index: Eight countries represented at UFC 317
content: MMA is a true example of an international sport . 10 countries are represented among the 17 divisional champions . 26 fighters from eight nations capping off the UFC's international Fight Week . the voting criteria were based on four factors: current champions, ranked fighters across all divisi .

title: Jon Jones operated on his terms, even in announcing his retirement
content: david frum: the retirement news of arguably the greatest mixed martial artist of all time was underwhelming . he says he was let down by the man he recently called the best pound-for-pound fighter in the world . his retirement squashed a highly anticipated heavyweight title unification fight between Jones and iraq . frum says it's not the end of Jones' complicated career .

title: Which Finals stars made our top five?
content: the Oklahoma City Thunder have been crowned NBA champions for the first time since arriving in the Sooner State 17 years ago . the NHL handles its postseason honors that way, with the Conn Smythe Trophy awarded to the player with the best overall postseason . we set out to fill that gap with our five-player MVP ballot .

title: Final draft rankings: Schaefer, Misa, Hagens, then...?
content: the top 64 are ranked here, along with details of their game, areas for development, perception among NHL scouts and an NHL projection . some players grade at higher or lower value than in previous rankings, but their position considers how likely they are to become NHL players based on their developmental needs and perception .

title: White Sox give minors deal to righty Syndergaard
content: Noah Syndergaard has signed a minor league deal with the Chicago White Sox . he hasn't pitched in the majors since 2023, when he appeared in 18 games split between the Los Angeles Dodgers and Cleveland Guardians . the 32-year-old has a career 3.71 ERA over the course of eight seasons .
